info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 10:42PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following river and locations in Indiana...Illinois...
Wabash River at Clinton, Covington, Lafayette, Montezuma, Vincennes, Mount Carmel, and Riverton.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river and locations in Illinois...Indiana...
Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, and Terre Haute.
.Widespread and significant flooding is in progress. Rains of four to over six inches has fallen.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wabash River at Vincennes.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Almost all unprotected areas flood. River cabins are surrounded by high water. Oil fields in lowland areas are inaccessible by land vehicles. Most local river roads flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Saturday /8:45 PM CDT Saturday/ the stage was 16.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EDT Saturday /8:45 PM CDT Saturday/ was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Sunday afternoon by around 300 PM EDT /200 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Lawrence, IL; Wabash, IL; Knox, IN
